channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Playground near Kilburn Arms pub, 5th July
item.description:
Constantly littered. Large bits of litter get cleaned away occasionally but hundreds of small bits of litter including broken glass and cigarette butts are never cleaned up. Dangerous for young children. There is also a problem with people leaving food for pigeons which are defectating over the playground.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kimberley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowing trees, 5th July
item.description:
Overgrowing trees on Well Hall Road between Lassa Road and Sherard Road. Growing below head height of anyone over 4 feet tall! Multiple trees on this stretch, not just the location pinned here. Causes issues when crossing not being able to see oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Well Hall Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose slabs in Elmhurst Road, 5th July
item.description:
The loose slabs opposite many driveways is very dangerous, the only driveways that are not dangerous are the ones in the second picture that have block paving. I think the driveway with lowered kerb should all be like this to avoid slips and trips, I have tripped numerous times because of this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmhurst Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Final clear up needed on Sherard Road, 5th July
item.description:
Yesterday the bulk of Sherard Roads issues were tidied up. There remains the corner with Well Hall Road that remains overgrown and some remains of ivy taking over the street. It is much better than it was though - thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Well Hall, London

item.title: Pile of big rubbish near 115-145 Godstow Road, 5th July
item.description:
Hi, we are having this pile of rubbish more than 1 month now, and it is growing and smells and attracts ruts, foxes, germs etc. And is located exactly on our building corner, near the bikes park, 115-145 Godstow Road, SE2 9AX, just few steps from door way. It came this week a maintenance car from council and cleaned some places in the field from the front of our building, but this pile of rubbish nobody touched it. I ask, if someone can come and clean this place please as soon as possible, as is very disgusting to walk to the pathway with this rubbish nearby and also the wind is spreading rubbish, rats will multiply etc. Thank you in advance!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Godstow Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 5th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
